TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is a doctor .

CARDINAL . On DATE , another doctor , PERSON , brought a case against the applicant before ORG , requesting compensation for defamation . PERSON alleged that the applicant had diffused false information among his patients to the effect that he had been selling a certain unauthorised medicine . PERSON relied on a note obtained from a certain patient FAC , in which the name of the medicine , as well as his name and work address were written . According to the plaintiff , this note was written by the applicant in order to damage his reputation .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings , the court heard statements from several witnesses such as doctors and nurses working at the health centre , who confirmed PERSON ’s account of the facts . In particular , some of the witnesses submitted that they had seen GPE with this note .
CARDINAL . At the hearing on DATE the applicant admitted having written the name of the medicine on the paper , but denied having written the other notes .
CARDINAL . It appears from the case file that the applicant did not request the court to hear GPE during the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court , on the basis of the witness testimonies as well as the statements given at the hearing of DATE , found it established that the applicant had directed the patients towards GPE and therefore ordered the applicant to pay compensation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed . In his appeal petition , the applicant submitted inter alia that the trial court had failed to hear evidence from GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE , finding the judgment of the first instance court in line with domestic law , ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a request by the applicant for rectification of the judgment .
